definitions.definition: a tenant's regular payment to a landlord for the use of property or land.
examples: rental, fee, lease I can't afford to pay the rent

definitions.definition: a sum paid for the hire of equipment.
pay someone for the use of (something, typically property, land, or a car).
examples: they rented a house together in Spain

definitions.definition: (of an owner) let someone use (something) in return for payment.
examples: he purchased a large tract of land and rented out most of it to local farmers
synonyms: sublease "why don't you rent it out ?"

definitions.definition: be let or hired out at a specified rate.
examples: skis or snowboards rent for $60â€“80 for six days

definitions.definition: a large tear in a piece of fabric.
examples: rip, tear, split, hole, slash, slit More"the rent in his pants"gorge, chasm, fault, rift, fissure, crevasse "a vast rent in the mountains"Morethe rent in his pantsgorge, chasm, fault, rift, fissure, crevasse a vast rent in the mountains

definitions.definition: an opening or gap resembling a tear in a piece of fabric.
examples: they stared at the rents in the clouds

definitions.definition: tear (something) into two or more pieces.
examples: snapping teeth that would rend human flesh to shreds
synonyms: sunder; raredissever "a crisis threatened to rend the Atlantic alliance"

examples: he rent the branch out of the tree

definitions.definition: cause great emotional pain to (a person or their heart).
